intro: Dammara ovata, commonly known as the oval-leaf dammara, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its simple, oval-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Dammara ovata is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
